item.description:
The monthly board meeting of the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest is open to the public.  We always welcome people who responsibly enjoy Myles Standish State Forest and want to become involved in hike/bike/trail ride leadership, trail maintenance, wildlife and endangered plant protection or one of the many other activities sponsored by the Friends in and around the State Forest, such as our annual fall fishing derby.

We are anticipating the loss of a number of founding members from the board this coming May owing to term limits. (No one can stay on the Board for more than 6 consecutive years.)  We need new people to join us. Are you interested? Let Rose know.  We particularly need new board members who can represent the interests of :

  • Equestrians and their horses
  • Cottage Owners  (the primitive cabins in the state forest)
  • Skiers  (cross country skiers and snowshoers)
  • Bicyclists  (mountain or road bicycling)

Our Board bylaws require us to seek out and recruit members from eight main user groups identified when the group was started.   If you know anyone from the above groups who actively uses Myles Standish, please let them know!  (The other four groups included in the board are hikers; hunters/fishers; wildlife observers and campers.)

For information on membership, visit the Friends web page (www.friendsmssf.com).
item.how_to_find_us: "The barn" is 100 yards up Lower College Pond Road from the forest headquarters.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Postponed- Friends board meeting for March
